name: switcheroo
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an unexpected change, especially one in which one thing or person is quickly or secretly exchanged for another: Devious websites could pull a switcheroo on your home page and install spyware. Lopez was at third base and Figgins at second - that's a switcheroo from what most expected.
More examplesFewer examplesThe singer's late-career switcheroo is not unusual; many long-lived acts change things up occasionally.Scientists who took part in the show said the producers pulled a switcheroo so they were not doing the interviews they thought they had agreed to.The non-cute sister Blanche used to be jealous of Jane! But then there was a switcheroo. Blanche became a big movie star and Jane became a nobody.The movie is premised on a breathtaking switcheroo, a shameless piece of misdirection.
